title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
summary:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off

Date: January 5, 2024

Source: Investor's Business Daily

The stock market faced significant declines on Friday, driven by a strong jobs report that heightened fears of persistent inflation. Major indexes, including the Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, closed lower, with notable performances from airline stocks.

Key Points:

  • The Dow Jones lost 1.6%, nearing 700 points, and closed below its 50-day moving average.
  • The S&P 500 dipped 1.5%, and the Nasdaq composite ended down 1.6%.
  • A robust jobs report indicated 256,000 jobs were added in December, which raised concerns about high inflation and potential Fed rate cuts.
  • Treasury yields rose, with the 10-year reaching 4.79%, its highest in over a year.
  • Airline stocks, particularly Delta Air Lines and United Airlines, soared after positive earnings reports.
  • Taiwan Semiconductor reported record revenue, defying market trends.

The California wildfires could result in losses exceeding $20 billion, according to JPMorgan.

Despite the overall market pullback, some stocks, like Delta and Taiwan Semiconductor, showed resilience, indicating sector-specific strengths amidst broader market fears.
newTitle: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: As we start the year, I have been reviewing... - The Times of India
GST notices worth Rs 1.12 trillion on online gaming companies stayed - Business Standard
summary:
Supreme Court Halts GST Notices Against Online Gaming Companies

Publication Date: Friday, Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court on Friday stayed show-cause notices on goods and services tax (GST) against online gaming companies, putting a pause on proceedings until a definitive resolution is reached.

  • The GST amount in question totals Rs 1.12 trillion.
  • The next court hearing is scheduled for March 18.
  • The dispute centers around the appropriate GST rate for online gaming—whether it should be 18% or 28%.
  • Online gaming companies advocate for a 18% tax, arguing it should be based on platform fees rather than the entire prize pool.
  • The ruling provides relief for gaming companies, preventing immediate tax coercion from authorities.
“This stay not only alleviates immediate pressure on gaming companies... allowing for legal clarity without procedural obstacles.” - Abhishek A Rastogi

Industry leaders express optimism for a fair resolution, confident it will lead to investment growth in the gaming sector.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts GST Notices Against Online Gaming Companies

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Plunges 650 Points After Jobs Report; These Leading Stocks Hit Sell Signals (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
summary:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off

Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Investors.com

The stock market experienced significant turmoil as the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost nearly 700 points amidst concerns over inflation and interest rates following positive job growth numbers. Airline stocks, particularly Delta Air Lines, outperformed despite the overall market decline.

Key Points:

  • The Dow Jones fell by 1.6%, closing below its 50-day moving average.
  • Job growth in December was significantly higher than expected, leading to inflation concerns.
  • Delta Air Lines shares hit an all-time high after surpassing earnings estimates.
  • The Nasdaq and S&P 500 also saw declines, with small caps suffering the most.
  • Overall market volume increased on the NYSE while decreasing on the Nasdaq.
  • Various insurance stocks faced declines due to exposure to California wildfires.
"The December jobs report indicates inflation is taking its time in getting down to the Fed's target of 2%." - Analysts

In summary, the stock market faced heavy selling pressure despite some stocks, like Delta and Taiwan Semiconductor, showing strength. Investors are closely monitoring inflation trends and the Federal Reserve's potential responses.
newTitle: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Drops 600 Points Amid Airline Stocks Surge

title: 'Penalise if...': MP writes to minister after L&T chairman's '90-hour' remarks - Hindustan Times
summary:
MP Requests Action After Controversial 90-Hour Workweek Remarks by L&T Chairman

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Following remarks by L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating a 90-hour workweek including Sundays, MP Raja Ram Singh has urged the Labour Minister to enforce working hour laws strictly.

  • Subrahmanyan's comments have ignited widespread outrage online.
  • MP Singh referenced esteemed business leaders promoting long workweeks.
  • He called for stringent measures to uphold labor laws protecting workers’ rights.
  • Long working hours are linked to various health issues, reducing overall productivity.
  • In a historical context, India's legal 8-hour workday has been a long-fought victory for labor rights.
“It is important to note that not only does working longer hours not ensure increased productivity, but in fact reduces productivity.” - Raja Ram Singh

This incident highlights ongoing debates about work-life balance and the enforcement of labor laws in India.
newTitle: MP Requests Action After Controversial 90-Hour Workweek Remarks by L&T Chairman

title: Double whammy: Hotel federation FHRAI goes after Swiggy, Zomato as NRAI flags private label concerns on... - Moneycontrol
summary:
FHRAI Challenges Swiggy and Zomato Over Private Labels in Quick Commerce

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) is taking action against food delivery giants Swiggy and Zomato for alleged unfair practices regarding their private labels.

  • FHRAI plans to approach the Ministry of Commerce and Industry regarding quick food delivery apps.
  • The organization accuses aggregator platforms of misusing their market dominance to promote private labels like Blinkit’s Bistro and Swiggy’s Snacc.
  • They are seeking meetings with commerce officials to enforce e-commerce regulations.
  • FHRAI represents around 60,000 hotels and 500,000 restaurants across India.
“We will be requesting the implementation of the e-commerce rules and strongly argue that these quick commerce players cannot have their own private labels.” - Pradeep Shetty, Vice President of FHRAI

This initiative highlights the ongoing tension between traditional restaurants and online food delivery services in India.
newTitle: FHRAI Challenges Swiggy and Zomato Over Private Labels in Quick Commerce

title: Rajiv Bajaj jumps in on ‘90-hr work week' debate: 'Quality of work matters, not time' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rajiv Bajaj also said that if one wants 90-hour work week, it should start from the top.

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Amid an online outrage over Larsen & Toubro (L&T) chairperson's “90-hour work week” remarks, Bajaj Auto's managing director Rajiv Bajaj has said that the quality of work done matters much more than the hours.

In an interview with CNBC TV18, Rajiv Bajaj emphasized that if there is to be a 90-hour work week, it should originate from the leadership. He stated, "Number of hours of work doesn't matter, the quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before."

Key Points:

  • Rajiv Bajaj argues that quality of work is more important than the number of hours worked.
  • Bajaj suggests that the idea of a 90-hour work week should start from company leaders.
  • He stresses the importance of work-life balance and the consequences of long working hours.
  • The controversy originated from remarks made by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for longer work hours.
"Even if someone works 70 or 90 hours a week, their life remains interconnected with other aspects - family, health, and well-being. Ignoring this interconnectedness will come at a cost."

In conclusion, Bajaj calls for a shift away from rigid work hours towards a more flexible approach that values quality and interconnectedness in life.
newTitle: Rajiv Bajaj Addresses Controversy Over 90-Hour Work Week Remarks

Cognizant CEO Accused of Anticompetitive Tactics by Infosys

Infosys has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant, accusing its CEO Ravi Kumar of engaging in anticompetitive practices.

  • Infosys alleges that Cognizant's actions have violated competition laws.
  • The counterclaim could have significant implications for both companies in the tech industry.
  • Ravi Kumar's leadership at Cognizant is now under scrutiny due to these allegations.
“Cognizant's CEO has crossed ethical boundaries in pursuit of market dominance.”

The accusations from Infosys may impact Cognizant's reputation and business operations in the market.

title: Gold price breaks out of pennant formation with investors fleeing for inflation - FXStreet
Surprising Dec US payrolls jump supports longer Fed pause - Reuters
summary:
Surprising Dec US payrolls jump supports longer Fed pause

Date: Jan 10, 2025
Source: Reuters

The U.S. job growth saw an unexpected acceleration in December, leading to a reduced unemployment rate of 4.1%. This robust performance adds credibility to the Federal Reserve’s cautious stance on interest rate cuts for the coming year.

  • Nonfarm payrolls increased by 256,000 in December, surpassing expectations of 160,000.
  • The unemployment rate fell from 4.2% in November to 4.1% in December.
  • The strength of job growth is likely to influence the Federal Reserve's policy decisions on interest rates.
  • Market responses included declines in stocks and increases in bond yields.
“The outsized strength in the November employment report puts a stake in the heart of more Fed rate cuts in the first half of 2025.” - Jack McIntyre, Portfolio Manager, Brandywine Global

This employment data reflects the ongoing strength in the U.S. labor market and suggests that future decisions on interest rate adjustments will depend significantly on upcoming inflation data.
newTitle: US Payrolls Unexpectedly Surge in December, Indicating Federal Reserve's Rate Strategy

title: Infosys charges Cognizant & its CEO of misusing trade secrets - The Economic Times
Barflex Polyfilms IPO: SME issue fully subscribed on day 1; check status, other key details | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Barflex Polyfilms IPO Fully Subscribed on Day 1

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Live Mint

The Barflex Polyfilms initial public offering (IPO) opened on January 10 and was fully subscribed on its first day.

Barflex Polyfilms IPO subscription status

The IPO was subscribed over 1.34 times on the first day, with 58,70,000 bids against 43,65,000 shares available.

  • Retail portion subscribed 2.39 times.
  • Non-institutional investors (NIIs) portion subscribed 0.69 times.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) portion remained unsubscribed.
  • IPO pricing is between ₹50 and ₹57 per share.
  • Allotment expected on January 16, 2025.
Barflex Polyfilms reported a revenue of ₹78.02 crore and a net profit of ₹13.49 crore for the period ending November 30, 2024.

Barflex Polyfilms specializes in flexible packaging materials, supporting various industries.

Almondz Financial Services Ltd is the lead manager for the IPO, which will list on NSE SME.
newTitle: Barflex Polyfilms IPO Fully Subscribed on Day 1

title: SEBI proposes doubling additional-disclosure threshold for FPIs having Rs 25,000-cr exposure - Moneycontrol
summary:
SEBI proposes doubling additional-disclosure threshold for FPIs having Rs 25,000-cr exposure

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

In a consultation paper issued on January 10, SEBI has suggested raising the bar to an AUM of Rs 50,000 crore to align with the increase in market volumes.

  • SEBI has proposed to double the additional-disclosure threshold.
  • The new threshold aims to keep pace with increasing market volumes.
  • This change is particularly relevant for Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) with existing significant exposure.
“This adjustment reflects the growing activity in the market,” SEBI states.

The proposal indicates a strategic move by SEBI to enhance transparency and governance in the growing market landscape.
newTitle: SEBI Proposes Doubling Disclosure Threshold for FPIs

title: What the Infosys counterclaim says about Cognizant in the TriZetto trade secrets case - Moneycontrol
summary:
What the Infosys counterclaim says about Cognizant in the TriZetto trade secrets case

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Infosys has alleged that Cognizant's anticompetitive behaviour has significantly contributed to rising healthcare costs in America.

  • Infosys claims Cognizant's actions are detrimental to fair competition within the healthcare industry.
  • The counterclaim highlights serious implications for corporate governance and ethics in the tech sector.
  • This case is part of ongoing tensions between competing tech firms over trade secrets and competitive practices.
Cognizant is accused of fostering practices that incentivize disloyalty among employees.

The resolution of this case could have far-reaching impacts on how trade secrets are handled and the ethical considerations within competitive practices in technology and healthcare.
newTitle: Insights from the Infosys Counterclaim Against Cognizant in TriZetto Case

title: Decoding India’s growth slowdown - The Hindu
summary:
Decoding India’s growth slowdown

Date & Source: January 10, 2025 - IST

The first advance estimate of India’s GDP in 2024-25 indicates a decline in the real GDP growth rate to 6.4%, down from 8.2% in the previous year. This decline highlights significant issues within the official GDP estimates and the implications of private sector investment trends.

  • The nominal GDP growth is estimated at 9.7% for 2024-25, lower than previous projections.
  • Concerns about the accuracy of GDP estimates due to reliance on the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) as a deflator.
  • Private investment continues to lag, with questions raised about the impact of corporate tax cuts on capital formation.
  • The growth in real gross fixed capital formation is projected to decline significantly.
  • The fiscal situation reflects challenges in achieving revenue and expenditure targets, raising concerns over public spending and growth sustainability.
“There is absolutely no indication of any structural break in the investment behaviour of the private corporate sector so far under the 11 years of NDA rule.” - Prasenjit Bose

The analysis of India's macroeconomic fundamentals underscores the need for a reevaluation of investment strategies and a renewed focus on achieving balanced growth amidst rising fiscal strains.
newTitle: Decoding India’s growth slowdown

title: New Honda SUV Finally Launched In India! - MotorOctane
summary:
New Honda Elevate SUV Launched in India!

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

The Honda Elevate has officially been launched in India with new cosmetic updates and two limited edition models. The launch comes after Honda's absence from the Auto Expo.

  • Available in Black Edition and Signature Black Edition models.
  • Features new exterior color schemes and upgraded interiors.
  • Price for the Black edition starts from Rs 18.15 lakh.
  • Rivals include Hyundai Creta Knight Edition and Kia Seltos X-Line.
“The new Elevate Black Edition will continue to offer a 10.25-inch touchscreen system, premium leatherette upholstery, and more.”

In conclusion, the Honda Elevate's new offerings aim to enhance its sporty character and compete effectively in the SUV market in India.
newTitle: New Honda Elevate SUV Launched in India

title: Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants - CarDekho
summary:
Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The updated Tata Nexon has been launched in India featuring two new colour options and three new variants, while the previous Fearless Purple colour has been discontinued.

  • Prices start from Rs 8 lakh (ex-showroom).
  • New colours: Grassland Beige and Royal Blue.
  • Introduced variants: Pure Plus, Creative, and Creative Plus PS.
  • No changes to exterior and interior design.
  • Maintains turbo-petrol, diesel, and CNG powertrain options.
“The Nexon continues to impress with its extensive feature list and competitive pricing.”

The MY2025 update enhances the Tata Nexon's offering, ensuring it remains a strong contender in the sub-4m SUV market.
newTitle: Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants

title: Multibagger stock Patel Engineering corrects 38% from recent peak. Right time to buy? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Patel Engineering Stock Drops 38%: Is It Time to Invest?

Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

Shares of Patel Engineering, a leading infrastructure and construction company, have declined significantly over the past seven months. This article discusses the company's recent performance, market outlook, and investment prospects.

  • Patel Engineering's stock has corrected 38.36% from its February peak of ₹79, trading now at ₹48.30.
  • Despite the recent slump, the stock has gained 209% over the last two years and 280% over three years.
  • IDBI Capital has issued a 'buy' rating with a target price of ₹76, suggesting a potential upside of 54%.
  • The positive outlook is attributed to a robust order book worth ₹173 billion and stable operating margins.
  • Analysts caution that the stock may face bearish momentum based on technical analysis.
"The pattern is approaching its neckline, suggesting growing selling pressure." - Jigar S. Patel, Senior Manager, Equity Research

In conclusion, while the stock has experienced a significant drop, analysts see potential for recovery dependent on market conditions and operational performance.
newTitle: Patel Engineering Stock Drops 38%: Is It Time to Invest?

title: IIP growth rises to a six-month high of 5.2% in November - Moneycontrol
Oil News: Crude Prices Surge as Supply Risks Drive Bullish Momentum - FX Empire
summary:
Oil News: Crude Prices Surge as Supply Risks Drive Bullish Momentum

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Industry Reports

Market dynamics are leaning towards an increase in crude prices due to supply chain concerns stemming from geopolitical tensions and rising demand for heating fuel caused by cold weather.

  • Potential sanctions on Russia and Iran could tighten global oil supplies.
  • Analysts project a significant increase in global oil demand driven by heightened consumption for heating.
  • Crude prices are rising despite a stronger U.S. dollar.
  • Optimistic forecasts regarding China’s economic recovery add to bullish market sentiment.
“Longer term, the market is focused on the prospect of additional sanctions.” - Ole Hansen, Saxo Bank

The surge in crude prices highlights the intricate relationship between geopolitical events and market dynamics, underscoring the need for stakeholders to remain vigilant.
newTitle: Crude Oil Prices Rise Amid Supply Risks and Cold Weather Demands

title: PCBL Chemical Q3 Results | Net profit slides 39%, revenue up 21%; declares dividend of ₹5.50 - CNBCTV18
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman's controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’ | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Amid ongoing controversy over L&T chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour work week remark, Rajiv Bajaj, Managing Director of Bajaj Auto, emphasized the importance of quality of work over quantity, suggesting that if a 90-hour week is to be enforced, it should start from the top management.

  • Rajiv Bajaj stated, 'Let 90 hours start from the top' during an interview with CNBC-TV18.
  • S N Subrahmanyan's comments about working on weekends sparked backlash, with many industrialists and politicians voicing their concerns.
  • Bajaj criticized the notion of long hours, advocating for improved outcomes through better leadership and empowerment of employees.
  • RPG Group’s Harsh Goenka also spoke against the excessive work hours, calling for a balanced work-life approach.
  • L&T clarified that Subrahmanyan's comments were intended to inspire extraordinary efforts for the nation's progress.
“Number of hours of work doesn’t matter, quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before.” - Rajiv Bajaj

In conclusion, the discourse surrounding work hours continues to evolve, balancing productivity demands with the necessity for employee well-being.
newTitle: Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

title: SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows - Upstox
summary:
SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows

Date: Friday, Publication Source: Not specified

Equity benchmark indices SENSEX and NIFTY faced losses for the third consecutive session due to concerns over economic growth and rising crude oil prices.

  • SENSEX dropped 241.30 points to close at 77,378.91.
  • NIFTY fell by 95 points to settle at 23,431.50.
  • Major laggards included IndusInd Bank, NTPC, and Tata Steel.
  • Tata Consultancy Services reported nearly a 6% increase in net profit.
  • FIIs sold off equities worth ₹7,170.87 crore on Thursday.
  • Global markets, including Asian and European stocks, closed lower.
“Surging crude oil prices and a strengthening dollar index contributed to the weak trend in equities.”

The persistent losses in SENSEX and NIFTY reflect broader concerns regarding economic conditions and market performance.
newTitle: SENSEX and NIFTY Continue to Decline Amid Rising Crude Prices

title: Q3 results next week: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank among over 60 companies to release earnings report - Upstox
summary:
Q3 Earnings Reports: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank and More Set to Release Results Next Week

Publication Date: January 13-17, 2025
Source: Upstox

The earnings season for the third quarter of FY25 is underway, with over 60 companies, including major players in the IT sector, set to announce their quarterly results next week. Investors are keenly awaiting these reports as they provide insights into the companies' performance and future outlook.

  • Major companies releasing earnings include Infosys, Wipro, HCL Technologies, and Axis Bank.
  • HCL Technologies will report its results on January 12.
  • Infosys is expected to show a revenue of ₹41,278 crore for Q3 on January 16.
  • Wipro's projected revenue for the December quarter is ₹22,040 crore, scheduled for January 17.
  • Axis Bank anticipates reporting a total income of ₹20,118 crore on the same day as Infosys.
  • The earnings are anticipated to reflect the economic conditions and business strategies moving forward.
“Investors will focus on management commentary on performance, outlook for the present quarter, profit numbers, and new deal wins.”

This earnings season is crucial for investors as the results are expected to highlight the resilience and adaptability of these companies in a changing economic environment.
newTitle: Q3 Earnings Reports: Infosys, Wipro, Axis Bank and More Set to Release Results Next Week

title: Exclusive: Foxconn stops sending Chinese workers to India iPhone factories - Rest of World
summary:
Foxconn Halts Chinese Worker Rotations to Indian iPhone Factories

Publication Date: August 2023 | Source: Rest of World

Foxconn is ceasing the rotation of its Chinese workers to its iPhone production facilities in India and instead relocating Taiwanese staff, causing potential disruptions to assembly lines and equipment shipments.

  • Foxconn is halting new rotations for Chinese employees in India.
  • Shipments of manufacturing equipment from China to India are delayed.
  • Apple aims to diversify production to reduce reliance on China.
  • The issue may be linked to actions from the Chinese government.
“Many in India will read this in a very negative light, whether or not the Chinese government is involved directly.”

This development underscores the challenges Apple faces as it expands manufacturing in India while managing geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and China.
newTitle: Foxconn Halts Chinese Worker Rotations to Indian iPhone Factories

title: Rupee hits all-time low of 85.97 as dollar strengthens ahead of US jobs data - The Financial Express
summary:
Rupee hits all-time low of 85.97 as dollar strengthens ahead of US jobs data

Date: N/A, Source: N/A

The Indian rupee dropped to a new record low of 85.9650 against the US dollar, marking its tenth consecutive weekly decline amid ongoing pressures from a strong dollar and weak capital inflows.

  • The rupee declined 0.2% for the week and has seen closing lows for three consecutive days.
  • The dollar index remains high as markets await US job data, impacting expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts.
  • The Reserve Bank of India intervened by selling dollars to limit the rupee’s losses.
Anuj Choudhary, a Research Analyst, stated, "Weak tone in the domestic markets, a strong greenback, and persistent FII outflows may continue to put downside pressure on the Rupee."

The outlook suggests continued pressure on the rupee, anticipated to trade between 85.80-86.15/$ in the near term.
newTitle: Indian Rupee Reaches Record Low Amidst Strong Dollar and Economic Pressures

title: Star Health Insurance to add 29-30 bancassurance partners by H1FY26: Biju Menon - Moneycontrol
summary:
Star Health Insurance Plans to Expand Bancassurance Partnerships

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Star Health and Allied Insurance aims to add 29-30 bancassurance partners by H1 FY26 to boost fresh business, as stated by Biju Menon, Executive Director & Chief Business Officer.

  • The company currently has 71 bancassurance partners, including major banks and non-banking finance companies.
  • Recent partnerships include Neogrowth, RBL Bank, Niwas Housing Finance, and Northern Arc Finance Ltd.
  • In FY25's first half, 15% of fresh business came from the bancassurance vertical, which the company aims to double in three years.
Menon mentioned, "We want to double the fresh business contribution from our bancassurance vertical in the next three years."

The strategic expansion into bancassurance partnerships is expected to significantly enhance Star Health's business model and insurance offerings.
newTitle: Star Health Insurance Plans to Expand Bancassurance Partnerships

title: Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data - The Hindu
summary:
Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data

Published: January 10, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

India’s industrial production (IIP) growth accelerated to a six-month high of 5.2% year-on-year in November 2024, driven by increased festive demand and a pick-up in the manufacturing sector.

  • The IIP recorded a growth of 2.5% in November 2023.
  • Previous high growth rate was 6.3% in May 2024.
  • Growth in factory output for April-November 2024 was 4.1% compared to 6.5% in the previous year.
  • Manufacturing sector growth accelerated to 5.8% in November from 1.3% a year ago.
  • Consumer durable goods production grew by 13.1% during November 2024.
  • Infrastructure/construction goods reported a growth of 10% in the same month.
"The capital goods segment growth accelerated to 9 percent in November 2024 against a contraction of 1.1% in the year-ago period."

The data indicates a significant recovery in the industrial sector, highlighting the importance of consumer demand during the festive season.
newTitle: Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data
